materials: RED HEART® Holiday: 1 ball each 1360 Aran/Gold A
removable stitch marker or safety pin
2 sets of ½” or ⅝” sew-on snaps
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: To Fit Neck: 8-11 (10-13)”. Finished Measurements: 1 x 11½ (1 x 13½)”.
gauge: 15 sts = 4” in hdc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
COLLAR
With A, ch 39 (46).
Row 1: Hdc in 3rd ch from hook and in each ch across; do NOT turn.
Round 2: Work Reverse sc as follows: ch 1, insert hook in last st worked and draw through a loop, yo and draw through 2 loops on hook, * insert hook in next st to the right and draw through a loop, yo and draw through 2 loops on hook; repeat from * across last row AND across end, the beginning ch and the last end. Fasten off.

POiNSETTiA FLOWER
Round 1: With C leaving a 12” yarn tail, make an adjustable loop; 6 sc into loop; join with a slip st in first sc. Pull on yarn tail to tighten loop and close center.
Round 2: * Ch 5, sc in 2nd ch from hook and next 3 ch **, slip st in next sc; repeat from * around, end at **.
Round 3: * Slip st in next ch, hdc in next ch, slip st in next 2 ch, ch 3, slip st in 3rd ch from hook, slip st in next 2 sc, hdc in next sc, slip st in next sc, skip next slip st; repeat from * around. Fasten off.

POiNSETTiA LEAF
Work as for flower with B.

HOLLY LEAvES (Make 8)
Round 1: With B, ch 7; slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, hdc in next 2 ch, sc in next ch, slip st in last ch changing to A; continue on opposite side of ch: [slip st in next ch, ch 2, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in next ch] 3 times, ch 2, slip st in 2nd ch from hook; now work across original sts: [slip st in next st, ch 2, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in next st] 3 times. Fasten off leaving a long yarn tail.

Finishing
Sew center of poinsettia to center of poinsettia leaves, staggering petals and leaves. With A, sew center of poinsettia to one end of collar with French knots in the center of the flower.

Include the feline member of your family when planning holiday wear. This poinsettia collar is crocheted quickly and is the perfect accessory for fashion-conscious kitties!

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Baby Shower™ (170 yds/155 m)
Size U.S. D/3 (3.25 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Chiclet = (Yoh and draw up a loop to height of beginning ch) 4 times in indicated stitch. Yoh and draw through all 9 loops on hook
instructions:
Notes
• Leash is worked back and forth in rows, with one Chiclet worked in each row.
• After a long strip of Chiclets is complete, edging is worked all the way around the outer edge of strip.
• Clip is attached to Binky as 2nd edging round is worked.
BINKY LEASH
Version I
With A, ch 4.
1st row:  (RS). Chiclet in 4th ch from hook. Turn.
2nd to 22nd rows: Ch 3. Chiclet in ch-3 sp of previous row. Turn.
Do not fasten off. At end of last row.
Edging
Note: There is a “V” shaped space between Chiclets along the side edges of the strip of Chiclets. 1st rnd is worked into these “V” shaped spaces.

1st rnd: With A, working along first long side edge, *Ch 5. 1 sc in next sp between Chiclets. Rep from * along first side edge. Ch 14. Working along second long side edge, sl st in next sp between Chiclets, **Ch 5. 1 sc in next sp between Chiclets. Rep from ** along second side edge. Ch 5. Join B with sl st in base of ch-5. Break A.

2nd rnd: With B, ch 1. 6 sc in each ch-5 sp and 18 sc in ch-14 sp all way around to last ch-5 sp. Hold base of clip tog with last ch-5 sp. 6 sc around base of Clip and ch-5 sp. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Version II
Work as given for Version I, omitting all color references.

FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Reflective™: 2 balls 8429 Grey A and 8704 Neon Pink B
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
measurements: Leash Cover measures 2" [5 cm] x 66" [167 cm]
gauge: 7 hdc = 4" [10 cm]; 4 rows = 4" [10 cm] in half double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
LEASH COVER
With A, ch 12, slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Sc in first ch, hdc in remaining 11 ch – 12 sts. Place marker for beginning of round. 
Round 2: Join B in last st with a slip st, sc in next st, hdc in next 10 sts.
Round 3: Change to A, hdc in each of next 10 sts.
Round 4: Change to B, hdc in each of next 10 sts.
Repeat Rounds 3-4 until Leash Cover reaches 66" [167 cm] from beginning or desired length, end with Round 4. 
Last Round: With A, sc in next stitch, slip stitch in next st, change to B, sc in next st, slip st in next st. Fasten off. 
FINISHING
Weave in ends. 
Slip leash into Leash Cover.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ (5 oz/141 g; 236 yds/215 m) Retro Stripe (4971) 1 ball
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Cluster = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice in indicated stitch. Yoh and draw through last 3 loops on hook.
gauge: 10 dc and 6 rows = 4" [10 cm] with 2 strands of yarn held together.
instructions:
Note: Doily is worked holding 2 strands of yarn together. To do this, work from both the outer and inner ends of ball together.
With 2 strands held tog, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. (Yoh. Draw up a loop in same sp as sl st just worked. Yoh and draw through first 2 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through last 2 loops on hook) – beg cluster made. Ch 3. *Cluster in next sc. Ch 3. Rep from * around, ending with ch 3. Join with sl st to top of first Cluster.
3rd rnd: Sl st in next ch-3 sp. Ch 2. Beg Cluster. Ch 2. Cluster in same ch-3 sp as Beg Cluster. *Ch 1. (Cluster. Ch 2. Cluster) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * around. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of first Cluster.
4th rnd: Sl st to next ch-2 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same ch-2 sp as sl st. *Ch 1. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of beg ch 3.
5th rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in first st. 1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Ch 2. *Skip next dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Ch 2. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
6th rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in first st. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Ch 1. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
7th rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Ch 1. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
8th rnd: Sl st in last ch-1 worked of previous rnd. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Skip next 2 dc. 5 dc in next dc. Skip next dc. 1 sc in next dc. Skip next dc. 5 dc in next dc. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

pattern_name: Ketchup and Mustard Crochet Pet Toys
materials: Bernat® Maker™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 317 yds/290 m)
Contrast A Jam (06008) 1 ball or 69 yds/63 m
Contrast B Saffron (06011) 1 ball or 69 yds/63 m
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
instructions:
Note:  Do not join at ends of rnds unless otherwise stated. 
Cont working in spiral placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting.

BOTTLE
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
3 sc.
Do not join, cont working in spiral as follows. PM for beg of rnd. 
Move marker up on rnds as work progresses.
2nd and 3rd rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
4th rnd:  2 sc in each sc around. 
6 sc.
5th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
6th rnd:  2 sc in each sc around. 
12 sc.
7th rnd:  *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
8th rnd:  Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around.
9th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
10th rnd:  Working in back loops only, *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 
24 sc.

11th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
12th rnd:  Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. 
13th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
Rep last rnd until work from 12th rnd measures 5" [12.5 cm].
Next rnd:  Working in back loops only, *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 24 sts.
Next rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 18 sts.
Fill Toy with stuffing and optional catnip.
Next rnd: *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 12 sts.
Next rnd: (Sc2tog) 6 times.
Fasten off leaving long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Crochet Nylon™: 1 tube 16 Natural.
Yarn needle, 1” D-ring, 1” Latch, 1” Snap Buckle.
measurements: Collar measures 1” wide x 9½” or desired length. Leash measures 50” long.
gauge: 16 sc = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the specified gauge.
instructions:
COLLAR
Row 1: Make a slip knot, working around one end of Snap Buckle, work 4 sc. 
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 4 sts.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 9½” from beginning. Fasten off.
Joining D-Ring
Row 1: With wrong side of Collar facing, join yarn 8½” from beginning and work 4 sc across row. 
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 4 sts.
Repeat Row 2 until working piece measures 1”. Next Row: Insert D-Ring in between 2 layers of Collar pieces. Working through sts of both layers to join, work 4 sc across row. Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 11½” or length to fit around neck. 
Last Row: Working around opposite end of Snap Buckle, work 4 sc.
Fasten off.
LEASH
Row 1: Make a slip knot, working around one end of Latch, work 4 sc. 
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 4 sts.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 55” from beginning. 
Fasten off.
